availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, banker. Kentucky native. Married Sophia Piner. Father of Cincinnatus A. Pinter, William A. Piner, and Cornelia M. Pinter. Married Elizabeth Piner. Coal Merchant in Newport in 1850. Owner of the Banking House of Joseph A. Piner in Newport in 1860. Employed Fannie Smith as a domestic servant in Newport in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, City of Newport, p. 135; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 249.
